channel.title: Tips on Qiu's Quibble
channel.description: Recent content in Tips on Qiu's Quibble

item.title: Launch Windows Explorer and goto the current working directory in shell
item.description: I like working in the command prompt - it’s fast and you can do batch processing, etc, but sometimes, I need a GUI (Windows explorer) to explore files in the current directory. I know I can type “explorer.exe” on the command line to launch Windows explorer, but can it automatically go to the directory I’m working in? The answer is yes, although hardly ever advertised Now, we need to find a way to find out the current working directory.
